solution.text:
Given that:
\(\angle A\) = \(90^{\circ}\)
AB = _{{3*i}}_ units , AC = _{{4*i}}_ units
Since, Given triangle is a right angle triangle, it will follow Pythagoras Theorem as follows:
\(BC^2 = AB^2 + AC^2\)
i.e., \(BC^2 = _{{3*i}}_^2 + _{{4*i}}_^2\)
i.e., \(BC^2 = _{{pow(3*i,2)}}_ + _{{pow(4*i,2)}}_\)
i.e., \(BC^2 = _{{pow(3*i,2)+pow(4*i,2)}}_\)
i.e., \(BC = \sqrt{_{{pow(3*i,2)+pow(4*i,2)}}_}\)
i.e., \(BC = _{{5*i}}_\)

content.text: \(\Delta ABC\) is right angled at A.If AB = _{{3*i}}_ units and AC = _{{4*i}}_ units,then find BC.
